name: Access to Education
description: Policies determining how refugee children access the education system

options.title: Limited Access
options.description: Limit access to education for refugees, allowing only a small percentage to enroll in mainstream schools. This prioritizes resources for citizens but excludes many refugee children from quality education, hindering their future prospects.

options.title: Separate Schools
options.description: Establish separate schools or learning centers specifically for refugee education. This provides dedicated education considering their unique needs but may foster segregation and limit integration opportunities.

options.title: Full Integration
options.description: Provide equal access to education for all, integrating refugee students into mainstream schools. This promotes integration and social cohesion but requires additional resources and support systems.

name: Language Instruction
description: Policies on language teaching approaches for refugee students

options.title: Teanish Only
options.description: Maintain the current policy of teaching only Teanish in schools, excluding other languages. This preserves linguistic unity but hinders effective communication and integration of refugee students.

options.title: Basic Teanish Courses
options.description: Provide primary Teanish language courses to refugees, enabling them to access essential services. This offers minimum language proficiency but limits broader educational opportunities.

options.title: Bilingual Education
options.description: Implement comprehensive bilingual education programs in both Teanish and the mother tongue of refugees. This facilitates better communication and cultural identity preservation but requires more resources.

name: Teacher Training
description: Policies on preparing teachers to work with refugee students

options.title: Minimal Training
options.description: Provide minimal or no specific training for teachers regarding refugee education. This requires fewer resources but limits teachers' ability to address the unique needs of refugee students.

options.title: Basic Training
options.description: Offer basic training sessions for teachers to familiarize them with the challenges and needs of refugee students. This provides foundational understanding but may not fully equip teachers for complex challenges.

options.title: Comprehensive Training
options.description: Implement comprehensive ongoing training programs for teachers to effectively support refugee students. This enhances teachers' capacity but requires substantial investment in professional development.

name: Curriculum Adaptation
description: Policies on adapting educational content for diverse student populations

options.title: Standard Curriculum
options.description: Maintain the existing national curriculum without modifications. This preserves continuity but neglects inclusion of refugee experiences and cultural diversity.

options.title: Supplementary Materials
options.description: Introduce supplementary materials that acknowledge the experiences of refugees while following the mainstream curriculum. This provides some recognition but may not fully address specific educational needs.

options.title: Inclusive Curriculum
options.description: Adapt the national curriculum to include diverse perspectives, histories, and cultural elements relevant to both citizens and refugees. This promotes mutual understanding but requires substantial redesign.

name: Psychosocial Support
description: Policies addressing the mental health and emotional needs of refugee students

options.title: Minimal Support
options.description: Provide limited or no specific psychosocial support for refugee students. This reduces immediate resource burdens but negatively impacts mental health and educational success.

options.title: Basic Counseling
options.description: Establish basic support services such as counseling and peer support programs. This provides some assistance for psychosocial challenges but requires trained personnel.

options.title: Comprehensive Support
options.description: Develop specialized psychosocial support programs offering tailored assistance to refugee students and families. This prioritizes mental health and integration but requires significant investment.

name: Financial Support
description: Policies on funding allocations for refugee education programs

options.title: Minimal Funding
options.description: Allocate minimal funds to support refugee education. This minimizes financial burden on the government but limits educational quality and accessibility.

options.title: Moderate Funding
options.description: Increase financial support for refugee education, though still insufficient to meet all needs. This provides additional resources but may not address all financial complexities.

options.title: Comprehensive Funding
options.description: Allocate significant financial resources to ensure adequate funding for refugee education. This enables high-quality support services but requires substantial budget commitment.

name: Educational Certification
description: Policies on recognizing previous educational qualifications of refugees

options.title: Local Recognition Only
options.description: Only recognize educational qualifications obtained within the Republic of Bean. This simplifies accreditation but disregards valuable prior learning, hindering integration and employment.

options.title: Universal Standards
options.description: Establish a comprehensive evaluation process for certification of previous educational experiences. This recognizes prior achievements but requires resources to evaluate diverse backgrounds.

options.title: Tailored Programs
options.description: Develop programs that combine recognition of previous education with additional training to ensure alignment with national standards. This provides flexible pathways but requires coordination.
